commit_message:
Replace libgcc1 with libgcc-s1 for Debian

libgcc1 is a meta package for Ubuntu 22.04, thus it's worth to
replace it with what this meta package actually provides.

Closes-Bug: #2045332
Change-Id: Ie95d42533e85f8e46d9c3d2c2691fed372144615
(cherry picked from commit c12dc00258b699bb4c38f62eaf6a1f27c377bce5)

commit_message:
Doc: Fix way to update default quota value for a new project

This commit adds a way to update a default quota value for a new
project when ``use_default_quota_class = True`` which is the default
setting. With the default setting, the original way which is updating
cinder.conf doesn't update the default quota value in the database, and
the value in cinder.conf is only used in an initialize phase. So, we
need to use CLI to update default quota values in that case.

Change-Id: I01114211010817fbc40e959c3db9045958c78d06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/69/845069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. To update a default value for a new project .. code-block:: console $ openstack quota set --QUOTA_NAME QUOTA_VALUE default Replace ``QUOTA_NAME`` with the quota that is to be updated, ``QUOTA_VALUE`` with the required new value.
deleted_lines: #. To update a default value for a new project, update the property in the :guilabel:`cinder.quota` section of the ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` file. For more information, see the :doc:`Block Storage service configuration </configuration/index>`.

commit_message:
Fix target_helper config for >= Wallaby

Starting with the release of Wallaby, the 'tgtadm' package is
now the default target helper, which doesn't work for cinder-lvm.
As such, we need to explicitly set the new package to 'lioadm'.

Closes-Bug: #1949074
Change-Id: I4d88d1e30d8b2b133bd575a76d0dc5e566415cbc

commit_message:
Fix traits to cpu flags mapping

Following keys like HW_CPU_X86_SVM and HW_CPU_X86_VMX are placed in TRAITS_CPU_MAPPING as part of a tuple instead of being direct keys.
This patch will flaten these tuples.
Closes-Bug: #2043030

Change-Id: Ia600ceb22c5939117095593b97ed94735c8f953c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/902183/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def make_reverse_cpu_traits_mapping() -> ty.Dict[str, str]: traits_cpu_mapping = dict() for k, v in CPU_TRAITS_MAPPING.items(): if isinstance(v, tuple): for trait in v: traits_cpu_mapping[trait] = k else: traits_cpu_mapping[v] = k return traits_cpu_mappingTRAITS_CPU_MAPPING = make_reverse_cpu_traits_mapping()
deleted_lines: TRAITS_CPU_MAPPING = {v: k for k, v in CPU_TRAITS_MAPPING.items()}

commit_message:
Parametrize file_list parameter config parameter

The host administrator might want to change the file_list parameter
to own one. Currently, the path and filename was hard coded, but
with that commit, it can be added as a parameter.

Change-Id: If920978f8df3536ba8a65228350d41706d5d1243

commit_message:
Use Docker healthchecks for murano services

This change enables the use of Docker healthchecks for murano services.
Implements: blueprint container-health-check

commit_message:
bifrost: Don't use env-setup

env-setup script removes epel-release and this
breaks our CI template overrides.
It is also more geared towards using in opendev
CI - let's just install proper Ansible version
instead.

Change-Id: I68f645bef05dd15eba41479e3ef6713100fb87d0

commit_message:
Update connection info in pre_live_migration

Connection info stays attaching after live
migration and other info such device path
is lost. To make info consistent, update
connection info when attachment complete
is done

Change-Id: Ifb4decb2cf6023dcf026998c7515f850a4aee201

commit_message:
Add constant to identify OVN LB HM ports

OVN metadata and OVN LB HM port (used for health checks) are both
using network:distributed in the device_owner field. Some tasks
in Neutron search by that value, considering just one port will
exist per network with that value.

This patch adds a new constant to differentiate OVN metadata ports
from the OVN LB HM ones. The latter will use a device_owner
of ovn-lb-hm:distributed to be different but will still receive the
treatment of a localport in the OVN NB DB.

Related-Bug: 2038091
Change-Id: I70de163fad34371de10fec28c51959384900ebc8
(cherry picked from commit b2e14b23f3aa3fa7ff86cd47f346bebe48256615)

commit_message:
Remove test duplications between tempest and n-t-p plugin

DvrRoutersNegativeTest - https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest\/
src/branch/master/tempest/api/network/test_routers_negative.py has
test_router_create_tenant_distributed_returns_forbidden and
SecGroupTest - https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/branch\/
master/tempest/api/network/test_security_groups.py has
test_create_list_update_show_delete_security_group implemented in
both tempest and neutron-tempest-plugin, so with removing these
tests from neutron-tempest-plugin we can reduce the test
duplications.

Change-Id: I4df71d0d249c522fea17081c183bfa24a3c51743

commit_message:
Fix haproxy_stats SSL path defenition

Neither `vip_interface` nor `vip_address` are defined or available in
the context they're being used.
Thus we need to refer to available variables in order to render base config
properly

Current version fail with "AnsibleUndefinedVariable: 'vip_interface' is undefined"
on "Drop base haproxy config" task.

This fix the issue that was introduced with [1] and backported back to Zed

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/Ib8be6b7fc3dada9d20905b0f07d90ddce0335605

Change-Id: I4e52378d8c5b3eaa6863ecaf0d04554d082e3dc0

commit_message:
sq: Namespace.name must be 'a/c' after all

... but without adding account and container attributes.

Change-Id: If6ff9503efe2051a7c515e2b0e816cef971208ed

def _check_name_account_container(self, ns, exp_name): # check that the name, account, container properties are consistent exp_account, exp_container = exp_name.split('/') if six.PY2: self.assertEqual(exp_name.encode('utf8'), ns.name) self.assertEqual(exp_account.encode('utf8'), ns.account) self.assertEqual(exp_container.encode('utf8'), ns.container) else: self.assertEqual(exp_name, ns.name) self.assertEqual(exp_account, ns.account) self.assertEqual(exp_container, ns.container) def test_name(self): # constructor path = 'a/c' ns = utils.Namespace(path, 'l', 'u') self._check_name_account_container(ns, path) # name setter path = 'a2/c2' ns.name = path self._check_name_account_container(ns, path) # constructor path = u'ሴa/
{SNOWMAN}' ns = utils.Namespace(path, 'l', 'u') self._check_name_account_container(ns, path) # name setter path = u'
{SNOWMAN}/ሴc' ns.name = path self._check_name_account_container(ns, path) def test_account(self): path = 'a/c' ns = utils.Namespace(path, 'l', 'u') self._check_name_account_container(ns, path) ns.account = 'a2' self._check_name_account_container(ns, 'a2/c') ns.account = u'
{SNOWMAN}' self._check_name_account_container(ns, u'
{SNOWMAN}/c') def test_container(self): path = 'a/c' ns = utils.Namespace(path, 'l', 'u') self._check_name_account_container(ns, path) ns.container = 'c2' self._check_name_account_container(ns, 'a/c2') ns.container = u'
{SNOWMAN}' self._check_name_account_container(ns, u'a/
{SNOWMAN}') def test_name_invalid(self): def check_invalid(name): with self.assertRaises(ValueError) as cm: utils.Namespace(name, 'l', 'u') self.assertIn( "Name must be of the form '<account>/<container>'", str(cm.exception)) check_invalid('') check_invalid('a') check_invalid('a/') check_invalid('/') check_invalid('/c') check_invalid(None)

commit_message:
Cleanup .zuul.yaml

If we agree, that we don't need to test anything older than
wallaby, then we can clean .zuul.yaml like this. After we drop
wallaby in the future, we can remove even more.

Change-Id: Ie437138a5befde3fe559fc9e75b7a5772f543f98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-tempest-plugin refs/changes/06/900906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This job is for testing telemetry components. We test stable branches from wallaby onwards.
deleted_lines: description: | This job is for stable branch prior to Ussuri for testing on py2. parent: devstack-tempest irrelevant-files: - ^(test-|)requirements.txt$ - ^setup.cfg$ - ^doc/.*$ - ^.*\.rst$ - commit_message:
Remove unnecessary ceilometer service overrides

The ceilometer services were removed from core devstack a long ago[1].
Unless the additional plugins are installed, overriding status of
the ceilometer services is just useless.

[1] e9a4750fe1b111eeb457378c26ca9eea1b5e0085

Change-Id: I35848c8041b22ab5fcf041f3561dbd11d33fe555

subject: fix rbac outerjoin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-09-22 13:37:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/db/model_query.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/95d3cd8d86ef5ef81a1767ba4158ea34e201dab7', 'message': 'fix rbac outerjoin

In our environment we have an external network with few subnets(20). We
use network rbacs to restrict access to it. Currently we have
networkrbacs for around 2500 projects for that network.

We noticed that the neutron api needs about 25 seconds for a POST request
to the /v2.0/floatingips endpoint. We traced it down to the neutron
find_candidate_subnets() method. Here sqlalchemy needs 14 seconds to
parse ~50000 results into subnet objects.

The outerjoin makes no sense because we get a result per subnet and
networkrbac. If the request is not project scoped we do not need to
check rbacs -> because they are mapped to projects

Change-Id: I6cd171882b1a48a87b52f5dd2c33f79943221def
'}]
commit_message:
fix rbac outerjoin

In our environment we have an external network with few subnets(20). We
use network rbacs to restrict access to it. Currently we have
networkrbacs for around 2500 projects for that network.

We noticed that the neutron api needs about 25 seconds for a POST request
to the /v2.0/floatingips endpoint. We traced it down to the neutron
find_candidate_subnets() method. Here sqlalchemy needs 14 seconds to
parse ~50000 results into subnet objects.

The outerjoin makes no sense because we get a result per subnet and
networkrbac. If the request is not project scoped we do not need to
check rbacs -> because they are mapped to projects

Change-Id: I6cd171882b1a48a87b52f5dd2c33f79943221def
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/39/896239/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace "tenant_id" with "project_id" in IPAM engine

This is part of the remaining technical debt of the specs
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/moving-to-keystone-v3.html

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/keystone-v3
Change-Id: I5e1887ddf1dbbd8332663e085084852591ae75cd

commit_message:
Adds protection in agent worker for failed jobs

This change causes the agent worker to continue working on the queue even if a job failed previously for any reason. Until now, if a job failed - the other jobs in the queue were never processed.

Related-Bug: #2037876
Change-Id: I61481202c154834f6a79382011722a4736b204ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/63/897463/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) try: update = self._queue.get() # Process the update only if it is fresh. if self._get_resource_data_timestamp() < update.timestamp: yield update except Exception as e: LOG.warninig("Failed to process update in worker, exception emssage :%s", e.message)
deleted_lines: update = self._queue.get() # Process the update only if it is fresh. if self._get_resource_data_timestamp() < update.timestamp: yield update

commit_message:
Fix router port deletion issue in DHCP agent

Upon router deletion, it triggers port deletion in DHCP agent but it fails to access "fixed_ips" key inside the object and therefor fails

Closes-bug: #2037876
Change-Id: I5d954a725d5f427898bc23d6adf10ee022fc621f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/64/897464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ('fixed_ips' not in self.resource or 'fixed_ips' not in other.resource): return super().__lt__(other)

commit_message:
HA router ports should bind as distributed

Ports that are HA interfaces have multiple bindings (based on
of hosts on which HA router interfaces are spawned). Such
bindings are created/updated here by invoking
update_distributed_port_binding.

Change-Id: Ib9285d49c878f3b649899c9cdc3614960afb7761
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/93/898093/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ports that are HA interfaces have multiple bindings (based on # of hosts on which HA router interfaces are spawned). Such # bindings are created/updated here by invoking # update_distributed_port_binding LOG.debug("Updating HA router %(router)s " "port %(port)s distributed binding host %(host)s", {"router": router_id, "port": port['id'], "host": host}) self.plugin.update_distributed_port_binding( context, port['id'], {'port': {portbindings.HOST_ID: host}})
deleted_lines: if not port.get(portbindings.HOST_ID): active_host = ( self.l3plugin.get_active_host_for_ha_router( context, router_id)) if not active_host: LOG.debug("Router %(router)s is not active on any " "host. Port %(port)s will not be updated " "now.", {'router': router_id, 'port': port['id']}) return try: LOG.debug("Updating router %(router)s port %(port)s " "binding host %(host)s", {"router": router_id, "port": port['id'], "host": active_host}) self.plugin.update_port( context, port['id'], {'port': {portbindings.HOST_ID: active_host}}) except exceptions.PortNotFound: LOG.debug("Port %(port)s not found while updating " "agent binding for router %(router)s.", {"port": port['id'], "router": router_id})

commit_message:
Regeneration new allocation_pools if allocation_pools is empty

If allocation_pools is empty list when update one subnet, we need
regeneration new allocation_pools from cidr and gateway_ip.

Closes-Bug: #2040457
Change-Id: I5e4fa6a294988cf43fa031b7d1cc734e6132b199
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/73/899373/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_pools_empty = (True if 'allocation_pools' in s and s['allocation_pools'] == [] else False) if new_cidr and ipv6_utils.is_ipv6_pd_enabled(s) or is_pools_empty: # # If allocation_pools is empty list, we need regeneration # new allocation_pools from cidr and gateway_ip new_cidr = new_cidr if new_cidr else s['cidr']

commit_message:
Enable new defaults and scope checks by default

Based on the agreed steps to implement the SRBAC community goal, this
enables the new policy defaults and scope checks by default.

commit_message:
CI: Run configuration dump against localhost

Since using the to_bool function in more places in
I3a5a43fef9c3d68d0db02be12b9f892c437e513d, we are now more strict about
the result of the variable dump. If there are no controllers in the
inventory, the result will not be a valid boolean and the to_bool
function will exit non-zero.

This change fixes the issue by running against localhost, which should
always be in the inventory.

Change-Id: Idcfd9d335f11f6c4d676033128d207f62b363ee9
(cherry picked from commit 0f1f009a853cdb6571059a43f33e81f3134d5f4a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/23/902523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ipa_build_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host localhost --var-name ipa_build_images) ironic_enabled=$(kayobe configuration dump --host localhost --var-name kolla_enable_ironic) overcloud_dib_build_host_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host localhost --var-name overcloud_dib_build_host_images) flag="$(run_kayobe configuration dump --host localhost --var-name kolla_enable_cinder)"
deleted_lines: ipa_build_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name ipa_build_images) ironic_enabled=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name kolla_enable_ironic) overcloud_dib_build_host_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name overcloud_dib_build_host_images) flag="$(run_kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name kolla_enable_cinder)"

commit_message:
CI: Run configuration dump against localhost

Since using the to_bool function in more places in
I3a5a43fef9c3d68d0db02be12b9f892c437e513d, we are now more strict about
the result of the variable dump. If there are no controllers in the
inventory, the result will not be a valid boolean and the to_bool
function will exit non-zero.

This change fixes the issue by running against localhost, which should
always be in the inventory.

Change-Id: Idcfd9d335f11f6c4d676033128d207f62b363ee9
(cherry picked from commit 0f1f009a853cdb6571059a43f33e81f3134d5f4a)

commit_message:
CI: Run configuration dump against localhost

Since using the to_bool function in more places in
I3a5a43fef9c3d68d0db02be12b9f892c437e513d, we are now more strict about
the result of the variable dump. If there are no controllers in the
inventory, the result will not be a valid boolean and the to_bool
function will exit non-zero.

This change fixes the issue by running against localhost, which should
always be in the inventory.

Change-Id: Idcfd9d335f11f6c4d676033128d207f62b363ee9
(cherry picked from commit 0f1f009a853cdb6571059a43f33e81f3134d5f4a)

deleted_lines: ipa_build_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name ipa_build_images) ironic_enabled=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name kolla_enable_ironic) overcloud_dib_build_host_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name overcloud_dib_build_host_images) flag="$(run_kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name kolla_enable_cinder)"

commit_message:
Fix deprecated regexes

Zuul is reporting warnings about deprecated regex syntax
whenever we change the .zuul.yaml. This change should
update the syntax to RE2 compatible syntax and get rid
of the warnings

Change-Id: I29682d99712be2cfca79e8633d02a714def56f7d

commit_message:
[WIP] Revert "CI: Migrate RabbitMQ queues during upgrade tasks"

This reverts commit e10446837113bbd65d6d84b38082797953282297.

Reason for revert: HA queues were reverted in kolla-ansible [1].

Also remove `om_enable_rabbitmq_high_availability: true` which was
present in the reverted commit.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/902038

Change-Id: Idd3e76d096b34d51fe76d04187d8be30379a0940

commit_message:
vs_port: Remove redundant list-port check in RHEL/CentOS

The same check is done in "exists" function.

Also, creating the port by ovs-vsctl can be skipped in case ifcfg file
is used to configure the port, because the port is created by network
scripts.

Change-Id: Ib38861be9b2e2c93fb572e6e64466fdcbc068f3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vswitch refs/changes/41/902541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fallback to oslo_cache.dict caching backend

If ceilometer has invalid or missing caching configurations,
'oslo_cache.dict' will be set as the default caching backend.

Project and user names will be discovered only when caching
and "tenant_name_discovery" parameters are enabled.

Also "tenant_name_discovery" parameter must be evaluated
from "polling" section and not "DEFAULT".

Change-Id: I149e408f5a65f214101c0516ed8046d297127145

commit_message:
git: support git checkout for a commit hash

git_clone assumes a branch or a tag is passed as the last argument, and
it fails when a commit hash is passed, as in:

timeout -s SIGINT 0 git clone https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn.git
/opt/stack/ovn --branch 36e3ab9b47e93af0599a818e9d6b2930e49473f0
Cloning into '/opt/stack/ovn'...
fatal: Remote branch 36e3ab9b47e93af0599a818e9d6b2930e49473f0 not found
in upstream origin

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/885901

Change-Id: Id1328d7cba418fa7c227ae9db4fe83c09fd06035
(cherry picked from commit e8915786e1e007742f47fee507b1b6288b6cedae)
(cherry picked from commit 5a47f37134486a4a9c149a82c5db80b39a3fcd30)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/85/887185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: git_timed clone $git_clone_flags $git_remote $git_dest cd $git_dest git checkout $git_ref
deleted_lines: # '--branch' can also take tags git_timed clone $git_clone_flags $git_remote $git_dest --branch $git_ref

git: support git checkout for a commit hash

git_clone assumes a branch or a tag is passed as the last argument, and
it fails when a commit hash is passed, as in:

timeout -s SIGINT 0 git clone https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn.git
/opt/stack/ovn --branch 36e3ab9b47e93af0599a818e9d6b2930e49473f0
Cloning into '/opt/stack/ovn'...
fatal: Remote branch 36e3ab9b47e93af0599a818e9d6b2930e49473f0 not found

commit_message:
[DNM] Debug osc keyring issue #2042943

Jobs fails randomly since the keyring is enabled
for osc commands.
Due to parallel executions and due to some race
something is adding duplicate cache_ids in the keystore
and that leads to issues, and until the keystore file
is removed all further execution of osc commands fails.
Gather the keystore data when the command fails.

Related-Bug: #2042943
Change-Id: Idfdc7cb119ce81cc4a2d997cd60f3fabef0d05df

commit_message:
Update master jobs to use Ceph Reef

Ceph Reef has been released recently [1]. It has been requested by the
storage specialist to move openstack to it from Antelope on [2]. This
patch is moving p-o-i jobs to use Ceph Reef from CentOS Storage SIG

[1] https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/releases/reef/
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdo-infra/ansible-role-dlrn/+/49997

Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdo-infra/ansible-role-dlrn/+/49997
Change-Id: I05f241235ef13b66ccd180bf21d1cfbd4f524de8
(cherry picked from commit d0f4cd3d70d3bad7763af5574b098674bc0290e5)

commit_message:
Disable RabbitMQ quorum queues by default

During PTG we agreed to disable quorum queues by default during this
cycle and wait for improvements proposed as part of [1] before enabling
it by default.

This also adds a separate job that will test scenario with enabled quorum
queues.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:bug-2031497

Change-Id: I0807cc1ed991fd85f9f74d4a360d3fd23cde227c

commit_message:
[stable/2023.1 only] Add integration jobs with Ceph reef

RDO switched ceph release for Antelope release from quincy to reef.
This adds a few additional integration jobs to test the same
combination.

The new jobs only run in check queue for now, because we already have
jobs with quincy for gate.

Change-Id: I38a9d74f2c4aea426f3292d9c4ba296fb16fc7ad

commit_message:
Create the base ovs provider

The commands to query or update ovs db records are similar for
different resources (bridge, port and interface).

This creates the base implementation to avoid maintaining similar
logics for multiple resources.

Change-Id: Ibd75f464af984987c27548a08da26dea622c7e79

commit_message:
vs_port: Avoid detecting partial name

This ensures that a different port, which includes name of the port
being created, is ignored when checking whether the target already
exists.

Closes-Bug: #2043921
Change-Id: I4a8db4e7b0da87a00ef097c8e066a11bfc5fde90
(cherry picked from commit 5b42cda62f4523a548f4bf9c213e89cb74251402)

commit_message:
Remove redundant hardcoded default of log_headers

The log_headers option defaults to no (which is effectively same as
False), so we don't have to explicitly set this option.

Change-Id: I0463331018dd1ff844caf0bc54f9abfe4627420e

commit_message:
Deprecate support for Cisco VTS mechanism driver

This implementation has not had any meaningful update for past 5 years.
The driver code is not publicly available so we can't know if our
current implementation is compatible with recent releases.

Change-Id: I395bbed2d7f311e7ce94d32b37746da878e44db9

commit_message:
Make log_udp_port optional

The [DEFAULT] log_udp_port option defaults to syslog udp port in case
it's not set, so users don't have to set this option explicitly.

Change-Id: I274271fd5bbcbac830d119797a0895f8651ba9df

subject: Resolve issue with seed service deploy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-28 21:47:11.000000000', 'files': ['dev/functions'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/856fa9b93610359ff2d994f7c68c42ca528ba601', 'message': 'Resolve issue with seed service deploy

The functions is_deploy_image_built_locally and
is_overcloud_host_image_built_by_dib are failing because they are
dumping configuration variables for the controllers group, which
can be empty on first deploy during seed provision.  The configuration
dump returns {} which throws an error when trying to parse it as a
boolean.

Change-Id: I2a383672d2c82eca2cb3c7d830b758af5ce7c92b
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve issue with seed service deploy

The functions is_deploy_image_built_locally and
is_overcloud_host_image_built_by_dib are failing because they are
dumping configuration variables for the controllers group, which
can be empty on first deploy during seed provision.  The configuration
dump returns {} which throws an error when trying to parse it as a
boolean.

Change-Id: I2a383672d2c82eca2cb3c7d830b758af5ce7c92b

deleted_lines: ipa_build_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name ipa_build_images) overcloud_dib_build_host_images=$(kayobe configuration dump --host controllers[0] --var-name overcloud_dib_build_host_images)

commit_message:
Use Inspector database to store inspection data

Ironic inspector supports different backends for storing introspection
data. Originally, the database was not an option, so Kayobe provided an
inspection_store nginx container that poses as a Swift object store.
It is now possible to store the data in the Inspector database, and
there is even a tool to migrate the data between stores. The database
option is simpler, and avoids running the nginx container.

This change switches to use the database store by default. The release
note provides information on how to migrate.

Story: 2010205
Task: 45929

Change-Id: I9c07e87ee43b3b56c3047ba983c42201dc659c82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/34/851834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Changes the default store for the overcloud's Ironic Inspector introspection data from the ``nginx`` based ``inspection_store`` container to use the MariaDB database. This avoids the requirement for the ``inspection_store`` container, and it will be removed on upgrade. *Prior* to upgrading, the existing data may be migrated to the database, by running the following on the controller that runs the ``inspection_store`` container: ``sudo docker exec -it ironic_inspector ironic-inspector-migrate-data --config-dir /etc/ironic-inspector/ --from swift --to database`` Alternatively, to continue using the ``inspection_store`` container, set ``inspector_store_enabled`` to ``true`` in ``$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/inspector.yml``.

zone creation.

added_lines: def test_create_zone_standard_ttl(self): values = self.get_zone_fixture() new_zone = self.storage.create_zone( self.admin_context, zone=objects.Zone.from_dict(values) ) # default fallback ttl is 3600 when no ttl value is provided. self.assertEqual(3600, new_zone.ttl) def test_create_zone_custom_ttl(self): self.config(default_ttl=60) values = self.get_zone_fixture() values['ttl'] = 30 new_zone = self.storage.create_zone( self.admin_context, zone=objects.Zone.from_dict(values) ) self.assertEqual(30, new_zone.ttl) def test_create_zone_override_default_ttl(self): self.config(default_ttl=60) values = self.get_zone_fixture() new_zone = self.storage.create_zone( self.admin_context, zone=objects.Zone.from_dict(values) ) self.assertEqual(60, new_zone.ttl)

commit_message:
Allow neutron managed ports to bypass PREROUTING chain

When deployed with k8s, k8s service types like NodePort
or ExternalIP will affect vm traffic on nat table's
PREROUTING chain. This PS try to mitigate the effect
by allowing vm traffic to bypass those rules.

Change-Id: Iae12d9c2f37bc0fca9c3d5e85e46c642263e4a77
Closes-Bug: #1908957

commit_message:
Use is_ovn_metadata_port from the ovn utils

Update the code to use the new is_ovn_metadata_port from utils.
Update the test such that mock port objects are subscriptable. This
is required for the `is_ovn_metadata_port`. I have utilized already
existing `Dictable` class. However, I have removed `__class__` as I
dont think this correct intention of this class. It was introduced
here [1] feel free to disagree.

commit_message:
Add more logging for lrp scheduling on gtws

Currently it is not entirely clear from the logs of the neutron-api,
on which gateway chassis and with what priority a Logical Router Port is
scheduled in OVN.
This commit introduces logging to have better visibility where a LRP is
scheduled and which gateway gets what priority.

Change-Id: I54dec6a6a6ab0989205898bab509ec69151b6dfb

commit_message:
Fixes multi-region with separate Keystones

Instead of just a list of region names, the user now defines a list
of region urls and names in globals.conf. Then all these are added
in Horizon's local_settings. For Keystone's endpoint creation, it
only creates endpoints for the regions that have a shared Keystone
with the current one. Also, changed the documentation to reflect
these changes.

Change-Id: I02871d9dbe042d3a446512ec45c0a99d4f2a9358
Closes-Bug: 1808970

commit_message:
Add ironic genericswitch configuration

Putting 'ml2_conf_genericswitch.ini' into /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/
doesn't make it loaded by neutron-server automatically.
Neutron-server loads it  by setting option '--config-file' explicitly.

Change-Id: Id1bf6e2a4df96908914f6afdf918bc3e9746bead

commit_message:
Use Docker healthchecks for freezer services

This change enables the use of Docker healthchecks for freezer
services.
freezer_api returns a 5xx code due to the compatibility of py2
and py3
freezer_scheduler doesn't listen to rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I6e7db31bf063581ba3eab51d6da1afcfa8c1337e
Implements: blueprint container-health-check

commit_message:
Adds the vitrage-snmp-parsing service.

Adds the vitrage-snmp-service configuration so this image can be
used in an openstack enviroment.

Closes-Bug: #1964780
Signed-off-by: Juan Pablo Suazo <jsuazo@whitestack.com>
Change-Id: I65a679b00b23f8255297363b72cfd464915413a4

commit_message:
[docs] Add more advanced service configuration examples

Add examples of OpenStack projects (e.g. nova) and services (e.g. nova
scheduler). Add examples on how to override configuration files for
OpenStack projects, project service and  project-service on specified host

Closes-Bug: #1916680

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/94/817994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

more than one tenant network/port during provision.

commit_message:
Ensure hostname resolved by kolla configured /etc/hosts file

Remove the existing host entries which conflict with kolla inventory
to ensure that the hostname resolution correct.

Change-Id: Ieb2c27b835f0638140ef7bf26eb00df79fa0a0e0
Closes-Bug: #1853578

commit_message:
deploy Zun with Ceph support

We can manual install the ceph-common in host, and set the
rbd_default_features=1 in /etc/ceph/ceph.conf. Additional,
we need add the Cinder's ceph config and keyring manual or
by ansible.After that, we can use this patch in kolla-ansible,
so the Zun can use the Ceph.

Change-Id: I6f9ed5ccec0032473920fc054217bda77eefefa1
Related-bug: #1797448
Closes-bug: #1848934

commit_message:
[haproxy] Support interfaces with '-' chars

Sometimes users may be trying to bind on interfaces that have a '-' in
them; Ansible will helpfully change this to a '_', so we must change it
back if we are to refer to the Linux device. This is mostly an issue
when using bridges. Ansible exposes the Linux device name as the
'device' attribute on the interface details.

This commit adds a way to retrieve this 'device' via a custom Jinja2
filter. Similar to kolla_address, this filter, named kolla_device,
returns the device name for a given Kolla network.

The kolla_address filter is updated to share some of the validation
logic with this filter and is renamed kolla_interface as a result.
Additional tests for the device filter are also added to the existing
tests for the address filter.

Change-Id: Ibe49eaf57992f0564d0e37cb7a7ffc891b2777c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/25/663325/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: interface {{ api_interface }} {{ kolla_internal_vip_address }} dev {{ api_interface }} {{ kolla_external_vip_address }} dev {{ kolla_external_vip_interface }} {{ kolla_external_vip_interface }}

commit_message:
Bump Markupsafe version to 1.1.1

version is 1.1.1

subject: Create stable document ids when pushing logs to elasticsearch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-22 11:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/filter/03-elasticsearch.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/output/01-es.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/output/00-local.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/tasks/config.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/267863a27226679ac650ac0ebe8ba85a13b1fb97', 'message': 'Create stable document ids when pushing logs to elasticsearch

by default fluentd will not generate document _id for every document when
pushing logs to elasticsearch, and elasticsearch will generate a new _id for
each document it receives. In a case of transient failure where elasticsearch
fails to process logs in time (resulting in timeout from fluentd side, or
timeout from proxy in-between) fluentd will retry an entire request as it has
no way of telling what has been processed.
This can lead to fluentd entering a loop where it tries to push the same data
into elasticsearch over and over, finally overloading it completely.

This commit enables filter bundled with fluentd-plugin-elasitcsearch[1] that
generates an unique _id for each and every document before uploading them
into elasticsearch, so that it can be deduplicated by the cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1896610

[1]: https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch#generate-hash-id

Change-Id: Ifd0544b0ec982e756d6d859f8f233a65208e7a0c
'}]
commit_message:
Create stable document ids when pushing logs to elasticsearch

by default fluentd will not generate document _id for every document when
pushing logs to elasticsearch, and elasticsearch will generate a new _id for
each document it receives. In a case of transient failure where elasticsearch
fails to process logs in time (resulting in timeout from fluentd side, or
timeout from proxy in-between) fluentd will retry an entire request as it has
no way of telling what has been processed.
This can lead to fluentd entering a loop where it tries to push the same data
into elasticsearch over and over, finally overloading it completely.

This commit enables filter bundled with fluentd-plugin-elasitcsearch[1] that
generates an unique _id for each and every document before uploading them
into elasticsearch, so that it can be deduplicated by the cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1896610

[1]: https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch#generate-hash-id

Change-Id: Ifd0544b0ec982e756d6d859f8f233a65208e7a0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/91/753291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - "conf/filter/03-elasticsearch.conf.j2"

'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2020-09-16 12:29:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/8a91a8552192bd599a2085398c2fec285232799f', 'message': 'Add support for custom logging file defined by user

Kolla-ansible deployment currently using default logging
behaviour from openstack.

This patch is adding support for custom logging defined by
user. This is very useful for users who wants to customize
logging options (for each service separately).

As an example, you can imagine that user wants to send
logs as JSON natively via python3-fluent-logger directly to some IP.
This can be now achieved by custom logging.conf defined
in /etc/kolla/config/{service_name}/logging.conf by user.

Change-Id: I0dd0834ab5872006a1402b2ebf7fd09d8f62fddc
Closes-Bug: #1842317

commit_message:
Add support for custom logging file defined by user

Kolla-ansible deployment currently using default logging
behaviour from openstack.

This patch is adding support for custom logging defined by
user. This is very useful for users who wants to customize
logging options (for each service separately).

As an example, you can imagine that user wants to send
logs as JSON natively via python3-fluent-logger directly to some IP.
This can be now achieved by custom logging.conf defined
in /etc/kolla/config/{service_name}/logging.conf by user.

Change-Id: I0dd0834ab5872006a1402b2ebf7fd09d8f62fddc
Closes-Bug: #1842317
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/12/679812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if custom logger_conf is present local_action: stat path="{{ item }}" run_once: True register: nova_logger_conf with_first_found: - files: - "logger.conf" paths: - "{{ node_custom_config }}/nova/" skip: true - name: Set nova logger_conf file set_fact: nova_logger_conf_file: "{{ nova_logger_conf.results.0.stat.path | basename }}" nova_logger_conf_file_path: "{{ nova_logger_conf.results.0.stat.path }}" when: - nova_logger_conf.results - name: logger_conf file merge merge_configs: sources: - "{{ role_path }}/templates/nova-logging.conf.j2" - "{{ node_custom_config }}/nova/logging.conf" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/nova-api/logging.conf" mode: "0660" become: true when: - nova_logger_conf_file is defined - inventory_hostname in groups['nova-api'] with_dict: "{{ nova_services['nova-api'] }}" notify: - "Restart nova-api container"

commit_message:
Add support for GlusterFS Native Manila backend

Follows existing backends patterns to add support for the GlusterFS
Native driver.

Change-Id: I72254da64aef8ba4eec785a170885a4b98f944dc

commit_message:
Removing of unused nova services after upgrade

In OpenStack Train there is not used nova-consoleauth
service anymore. So this patchset adds removing of it
after upgrade to Train.

Also after this upgrade nova-scheduler is duplicated
in OpenStack services output. It is caused by connecting new
nova-scheduler service to different DB. So this new service
is stored on different place and nova-scheduler service
is visible in DB twice.
This change removes old entries of nova-scheduler after upgrade.

Closes-Bug: #1863107
Signed-off-by: o.horecny2 <o.horecny2@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: Ibe7c06995852e478305942cadceea8f28adbdc93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/47/765347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Remove unused nova services gather_facts: false hosts: - nova-conductor - '&enable_nova_True' tasks: - import_role: role: nova tasks_from: remove_unused_services when: - enable_nova | bool - kolla_action == 'upgrade'

commit_message:
Enable TLS backend for designate

Adds support for TLS backend for designate.

Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network
Change-Id: I7239be00e01f0880387f7252109231723d8e8672

commit_message:
CI: Use docker_debug and docker_registry_mirror

Instead of docker_custom_config in an effort to use the same
variables on podman side in separate patches.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-collection-kolla/+/899668
Change-Id: Ib0dce9f7897c065bf84cee78a0e11b92d20b18df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/69/899669/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: docker_debug: true docker_registry_mirrors: - {{ infra_dockerhub_mirror }}"

commit_message:
CI: Run configuration dump against localhost

Since using the to_bool function in more places in
I3a5a43fef9c3d68d0db02be12b9f892c437e513d, we are now more strict about
the result of the variable dump. If there are no controllers in the
inventory, the result will not be a valid boolean and the to_bool
function will exit non-zero.

This change fixes the issue by running against localhost, which should
always be in the inventory.

Change-Id: Idcfd9d335f11f6c4d676033128d207f62b363ee9

subject: Add support for OVN MAC_Binding aging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-09-01 22:34:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f40bd262349f3d750b93cc52dd98f2e86c53b2db', 'message': 'Add support for OVN MAC_Binding aging

OVN added support for aging out MAC_Binding entries [1][2].
Without this feature, the MAC_Bindings table can grow indefinitely.

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/1a947dd3073628d2f2655f46ee7d3db62ed15b55
[2] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/cecac71c0e49f9bfb6595bc03a13f3f7644dd268

Closes-Bug: 2033932

commit_message:
Add support for OVN MAC_Binding aging

OVN added support for aging out MAC_Binding entries [1][2].
Without this feature, the MAC_Bindings table can grow indefinitely.

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/1a947dd3073628d2f2655f46ee7d3db62ed15b55
[2] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/cecac71c0e49f9bfb6595bc03a13f3f7644dd268

Closes-Bug: 2033932
Change-Id: I91070ad6addb30ffdedba5d561984d2f6626e2b7

commit_message:
l3_extra_gws: Add PRECOMMIT_UPDATE receiver

The apidef allows for updating the `enable_default_route_bfd` and
`enable_default_route_ecmp` router extra attributes, however the
extension does currently not implement a receiver for it.

Signed-off-by: Frode Nordahl <frode.nordahl@canonical.com>
Change-Id: Ic7b73fb58fd2e3a6c689511038c0681cf99a1cfb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/897821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _process_bfd_ecmp_create(self, resource, event, trigger, payload): @registry.receives(resources.ROUTER, [events.PRECOMMIT_UPDATE]) def _process_bfd_ecmp_update(self, resource, event, trigger, payload): router = payload.request_body router_db = payload.desired_state print(f'HELLO-UPDATE {router} {router_db}') for attr in (l3_enable_default_route_bfd.ENABLE_DEFAULT_ROUTE_BFD, l3_enable_default_route_ecmp.ENABLE_DEFAULT_ROUTE_ECMP): value = router.get(attr, None) if value is not None: self.set_extra_attr_value(router_db, attr, value)

commit_message:
wsgi: Handle multiple USR1 signals in quick succession

Previously, if another USR1 came in between when the re-exec'd process
and when it set up the signal handler, it'd just die.

Only do this for py3 (where we have signal.pthread_sigmask available);
anyone unfortunate enough to still be on py2 is on their own.

Change-Id: Ib2dd9513d3bb7c7686e6fa35485317bbad915876
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/96/747496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: del os.environ[NOTIFY_FD_ENV_KEY] # When we were reloaded, we blocked SIGUSR1 so we wouldn't get killed # before the signal handler was in place again. Now that we've notified # old-us, we're also ready to handle SIGUSR1 again. signal.pthread_sigmask(signal.SIG_UNBLOCK, [signal.SIGUSR1]) signal.pthread_sigmask(signal.SIG_BLOCK, [signal.SIGUSR1])

subject: l3_extra_gws: Fix update_external_gateways handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-10-10 12:33:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/292b6da417e0f67a3d27525ac3eb991a949a1cd5', 'message': 'l3_extra_gws: Fix update_external_gateways handling

When the `update_external_gateways` API endpoint is called with
a set of IPs different than the ones currently existing for a
router, the current code will raise an `UnableToMatchGateways`
exception.

We fix this by adding a optional `no_match_fixed_ip_fatal`
argument to `_match_requested_gateway_ports` and by returning
the requested port info in `nonexistent_port_info`.

After this, a new port will be created as expected.  The now
surplus port is also identified for removal in the
`ports_to_remove` set.

However, the list comprehension used to filter the removal request
is based on input from user, and not the actual list of external
gateway ports attached to the router, leading to a failure to
remove the unwanted port.

Replace the `ports_to_remove` set with a list comprehension of
actual router gw ports for input to the `_remove_external_gateways`
method.

This change also avoids unneccesary calls to
`_remove_external_gateways` as all ports for removal are passed in
at once instead of one at a time in iteration.

Signed-off-by: Frode Nordahl <frode.nordahl@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I5dccb7b9ba3a432e32baf37d30af02c6a393c9b1

commit_message:
l3_extra_gws: Fix update_external_gateways handling

When the `update_external_gateways` API endpoint is called with
a set of IPs different than the ones currently existing for a
router, the current code will raise an `UnableToMatchGateways`
exception.

We fix this by adding a optional `no_match_fixed_ip_fatal`
argument to `_match_requested_gateway_ports` and by returning
the requested port info in `nonexistent_port_info`.

After this, a new port will be created as expected.  The now
surplus port is also identified for removal in the
`ports_to_remove` set.

However, the list comprehension used to filter the removal request
is based on input from user, and not the actual list of external
gateway ports attached to the router, leading to a failure to
remove the unwanted port.

Replace the `ports_to_remove` set with a list comprehension of
actual router gw ports for input to the `_remove_external_gateways`
method.

This change also avoids unneccesary calls to
`_remove_external_gateways` as all ports for removal are passed in
at once instead of one at a time in iteration.

Signed-off-by: Frode Nordahl <frode.nordahl@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix pylint "W" missing-timeout warnings

After updating pylint, it started emitting additional "W"
warnings in some cases. Fix the missing-timeout ones by
adding a timeout=60 value to the calls done by the
metadata agent code.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Ica5c2a2d3941813b3518b83738ada96bdf7c3760

commit_message:
l3_extra_gws: Listing GW ports requires admin context

During testing we found several places where the current code is
unable to find GW ports due to using an unpriviliged context to
list them.

Signed-off-by: Frode Nordahl <frode.nordahl@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I253f8caf1e1c52244cee22a22ee1773740165d55

commit_message:
Improve logging in the dnsmasq DHCP provider

Currently, it logs a lot of entries without context, which won't be
readable when several nodes are deployed at the same time, nor when
someone greps for a node UUID.

Make fewer log entries and add node UUID for context.

While here, modernize the code a bit.

Change-Id: I3a840e47a09e77a9f8d35a7cf400c4bdd4111f91

commit_message:
Enable swift payload upgrades for wallaby+

Sync charm-helpers to pick up fix for openstack_upgrade_available
that enables successful payload upgrades. This will need backporting
to stable/wallaby.

The openstacksdk version is pinned in test-requirements.txt to enabled
py36 unit tests to run successfully.

https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/870
Closes-Bug: #2040606
Change-Id: Ic17c70d4649f1dd4ea812363507ac9324dade2b2

commit_message:
Enable swift payload upgrades for wallaby+

Sync charm-helpers to pick up fix for openstack_upgrade_available
that enables successful payload upgrades. This will need backporting
to stable/wallaby.

The openstacksdk version is pinned in test-requirements.txt to enabled
py36 unit tests to run successfully.

https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/871
Closes-Bug: #2040606
Change-Id: I876f265b69004bcb082e6758882a20f99d0cbca1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-swift-storage refs/changes/20/899620/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if service_type -%} service_type = {{ service_type }} {% endif -%} service_token_roles = {{ admin_role }} service_token_roles_required = True

added_lines: import contextlibfrom charmhelpers.core.hookenv import ( env_proxy_settings, ) ProxyHandler@contextlib.contextmanager def proxy_env(): """ Creates a context which temporarily modifies the proxy settings in os.environ. """ restore = {**os.environ} # Copy the current os.environ juju_proxies = env_proxy_settings() or {} os.environ.update(**juju_proxies) # Insert or Update the os.environ yield os.environ for key in juju_proxies: del os.environ[key] # remove any keys which were added or updated os.environ.update(**restore) # restore any original values handlers = [] handlers.append(HTTPBasicAuthHandler(passman)) with proxy_env(): handlers.append(ProxyHandler()) opener = build_opener(*handlers) install_opener(opener) response = urlopen(source)
deleted_lines: authhandler = HTTPBasicAuthHandler(passman) opener = build_opener(authhandler) install_opener(opener) response = urlopen(source)

commit_message:
Support disabling apache wsgi socket rotation

Bug LP 1863232 introduced a new Apache configuration option called
WSGISocketRotation which allows users to disable wsgi socket
rotation. This patch makes this configurable with a new
wsgi-socket-rotation config option that defaults to the Apache
default and can optionally be set to False.

Closes-Bug: #2021550
Change-Id: Ibf54e8ed543e7ace93e24a494665cf40bfbba54b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder refs/changes/55/897755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if wsgi_socket_rotation -%} WSGISocketRotation On {% else -%} WSGISocketRotation Off {% endif -%}

commit_message:
Enable swift payload upgrades for wallaby+

Sync charm-helpers to pick up fix for openstack_upgrade_available
that enables successful payload upgrades. This will need backporting
to stable/wallaby.

https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/867
Closes-Bug: #2040606
Change-Id: I91880c6b17e70d7c522b5e56e011fcc1e817efeb

commit_message:
chore: Update the BTRFS disk check for AIOs

The disk check for AIO deployments using BTRFS was breaking due to
a change in the command line utility output. This change updates
the commands we use to ensure that the output is usable.

Change-Id: I548ad1a4a0ee7527f7b5fcd871ed55c9bc5ce6e7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/70/901170/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: btrfs fi du -s --raw / 2>/dev/null | awk '/[0-9]/ {print $2*1024}'

commit_message:
Fix prometheus error on ceph dashboard

Ceph dashboard config for promethues is set to ctlplane(provisioning)
network during deployment due to which dashboard couldn't reach
prometheus API.
While the haproxy config uses storage n/w for prometheus.

This patch will update the deployment to use storage n/w for
promethus dashboard config.

Resolves: rhbz#2251176
Change-Id: I65de317bede578cf6a702980687ac55871ecf97f

deleted_lines: - name: get Grafana instance(s) addresses set_fact: grafana_server_addrs: "{{ (grafana_server_addr | default([])) | union([hostvars[item][tripleo_ceph_dashboard_net]]) }}" tripleo_ceph_dashboard_net: "{{ service_net_map['ceph_dashboard_network'] + '_ip' }}" {{ tripleo_cephadm_ceph_cli }} dashboard set-alertmanager-api-host http://{{ grafana_server_addrs | first }}:9093 http://{{ grafana_server_addrs | first }}:{{ tripleo_cephadm_prometheus_port }}

commit_message:
Update Pure Storage NVMe Cinder driver

With the development of additional NVMe transport layers
for the NVMe driver we need to make the names used more generic
and add in the new parameter ``pure_nvme_transport`` to
define which layer the driver uses.

Options for this parameter are ``roce`` and ``tcp``.

Change-Id: I3f67f5ce4d85c2b7b77011e36ced73ed6e05179a

commit_message:
Remove ovs_integration_bridge configuration option

This option has been marked deprecated since Ussuri
as it is a duplicate of OVS:integration_bridge, let's
remove it.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Add default policy on device_id param create_port

Add default policy on create_port for device_id parameter. This
parameter is only for admin or service role.

Closes-Bug: #1986969
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/861172
